text: Mark Gordon (born March 14, 1957) is an American politician. On January 7, 2019, he became the 33rd Governor of Wyoming. He was the treasurer of the U.S. state of Wyoming from 2012 to 2019. He is a Republican. Gordon was appointed state treasurer by Governor Matt Mead on October 26, 2012. In 2008, Gordon was an unsuccessful candidate in the Republican primary for the United States House of Representatives for the at-large seat now held by fellow Republican Cynthia Lummis. Gordon ran for Governor in the 2018 election and won the general election. ==References== Category:1957 births Category:Living people Category:Governors of Wyoming Category:Politicians from New York City Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Mark Gordon (politician)
